title: Structural Equation Modeling-Based Science Education Curriculum for Enhancing Instructional Design Imagination Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Strengthening Creative Instructional Design Competencies in a BYOD-Based VR Simulation Environment

learning_goals: In science education contexts, instructional design competencies utilizing creative and reproductive imagination can be enhanced by over 80%.

Using structural equation modeling (SEM), learners will identify three personal psychological factors (creativity, self-efficacy) and two school environmental factors (resource accessibility, teacher support) influencing instructional design creativity, build an analysis model using AMOS or R lavaan packages, and present an optimized model meeting modification indices below 0.2
Creative instructional design prototypes are developed and evaluated three or more times via VR-based simulations.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
